lines.text: Stand back! Unhand that woman... or my trusty pistol will bark your doom!
Swim for your life, Priscilla! Better a watery grave than life in the clutches of these blackguards!
Priscilla! What a pretty young woman you've growed to be!
Here's to her! The Heaven it's been findin' her... and the Hell it'd be to lose her!
Go on... ask him! Don't stand there blushin' like a port light!
He's-a no sailor! He's-a de nurse-girl!
You licked Dog-nose Danny, the toughest sailor afloat! You've earned a right to sail with me now.
There is always a Sunday morning after a Saturday night.
Noah needs you on deck, Mark! We're fightin' a snortin' gale!
Let 'er blow! Storms at sea ain't nothin'! They always stop! It's storms in the heart that never stop... like Priscilla's stirred up in mine!
Come on, Mark! There's a mad sea and a crazy gale challengin' us Shores to fight!
Challengin' us Shores, eh? Wantin' fight, are you? Come on then... howl and roar your damndest!
Kinda recognize beauty when you lay eyes on it, don't you?
Six months in Singapore has made of Mark a drink-crazed, half-mad, gibbering derelict.

[singing]
No five or ten or a thousand men, Are as good as any Shore!
Stop! Stop! For six months all I hear is the same crazy song!
Aloft there! Reef her down! Lively with it... or I'll slit your gizzards!
You... came... for... me?
I'll brain both of you love-thievin' hypocrites!
Soon as you've come to your senses, I'll give the ship over to you!
And when you do, I'll feed you to the sharks!
You're no brother of mine... you ship-thievin', woman stealin' swine!
Taste the iron, you crummy lubbers!
Off Cape Horn - The cradle of winds... the grave of ships.

[entry made by Captain Mark Shore in ship's log]
October 10, 1857 - On this day my brother, Noah Shore, first mate of the Nathan Ross, was swept to sea in a full North-western gale and lost.
